definitions: Past participle of sink: to go down below the surface of water, another liquid, or a soft substance.
Past participle of sink: to cause (something) to go down below the surface of water, another liquid, or a soft substance.
Past participle of sink: to decrease in amount, value, or strength.
Past participle of sink: to put money into a business or investment.
examples: He had sunk the ball into the hole.
Her spirits had sunk after the news.
They had sunk a lot of capital into the project.
